text: The white-bellied skink (Oligosoma hoparatea) is a species of skink endemic to the South Island of New Zealand. It is critically endangered, with an estimated 250 individuals in the wild.https://www.doc.govt.nz/white-bellied- skink ==References== Category:Oligosoma Category:Reptiles of New Zealand Category:Reptiles described in 2018 Category:Taxa named by Anthony Whitaker Category:Taxa named by David G. Chapple Category:Taxa named by Rod A. Hitchmough Category:Taxa named by Marieke Lettink Category:Taxa named by Geoff B. Patterson
title: White-bellied skink
